Articles.Content: I've been wondering, with significant modification would it be possible for a SLS with Pyrios boosters be capable of being modified for full or partial reusability? It would cut payload quite a bit but would the reduced cost per launch should make up for this?

What's Pyrios?

A liquid fueled rocket, presumably these would either supplement the typical SRBs, or be used to fly back the central core

What's Pyrios?

An alternative booster they are developing for it. Liquid fuelled and each booster uses a pair of F-1 Engines.
Each booter has 2 F1 Engines? Damn, thats alot

No Chance. There are several resons for this:

SLS is supposed to carry payloads no other rocket can carry, reducing the payload would make the wohle rocket pointless.

The core stage is far to fast on burn out, it would have to make a complete reentry and requires thermal protection that would extremly reduce the payload.

The Pyrios boosters are powered by 2 F1-B engines. For symetric thrust you would have to use both at once and 2 F1-B is the exact opposite of the carefull controlled low thrust you would need for a powered descent...

^^The Space Shuttle SRB (which is the basis for the ones used on the SLS - I believe the first flights will use extended SRBs and eventually, new boosters (liquid or solid) will be made according to Wikipedia) has 80% more thrust than a Saturn V F-1 engine, so 2 F-1s is a bit more than a normal Shuttle SRB.
